examples: The food looks good.
Good wine can make a meal.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
This information is as good as gold.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is satisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng thỏa mãn

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is unsatisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng không thỏa mãn

examples: The colorful bird flew high in the sky.
The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
Unfortunately, the price of short ribs can be quite high.
He had high expectations for the team's performance in the tournament.
They set high standards of customer service.
words.defineEn: having an amount, degree, size, etc, that is greater than normal
words.defineVi: có số lượng, mức độ, kích thước, v.v., lớn hơn bình thường

examples: The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
The government makes a big thing out of public support.
His dedication and hard work played a big part in the company's success.
The conference attracted many big names in the tech industry.
We're talking big money.
words.defineEn: large or above average in size, amount, degree, etc.
words.defineVi: lớn hoặc trên mức trung bình về kích thước, số lượng, mức độ, v.v.

examples: Small cracks appeared in the wall.
That holiday cost me a small fortune.
This small restaurant is the best pound for pound in the city.
The whole may be smaller than the sum of its parts!
I gave a small donation.
words.defineEn: little or below average in size, amount, degree, etc.
words.defineVi: ít hoặc dưới mức trung bình về kích thước, số lượng, mức độ, v.v.

examples: I'm finding the advanced physics a bit heavy going.
They pushed the heavy box across the room.
The book is really heavy going at the beginning.
We loaded the heavy boxes onto the truck for transport.
She carried a heavy load of books in her backpack.
words.defineEn: having a lot of weight and not easy to move or pick up
words.defineVi: có nhiều trọng lượng và không dễ di chuyển hoặc nhặt lên

examples: The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The lights changed to green.
Sometimes darkness can show you the light.
A major technological advancement like that is still light years away.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
words.defineEn: having very little weight and easy to move or pick up
words.defineVi: có rất ít trọng lượng và dễ dàng di chuyển hoặc lấy

examples: The new restaurant is expensive.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
He bought an expensive watch as a gift for his father.
The restaurant had expensive prices, but the food was delicious.
words.defineEn: having a high price
words.defineVi: có giá cao

examples: Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
It was dirt cheap.
He found a cheap flight deal for his vacation.
She bought cheap headphones, but the sound quality was poor.
words.defineEn: having a low price
words.defineVi: có giá thấp

examples: My father is quite old now
This thankless IT support job is really getting old.
This old house gives me the willies.
The old man gave up the ghost.
The old man considered his granddaughter thoughtfully.
words.defineEn: (of a thing) having been used or existing for a long period of time
words.defineVi: (của một thứ) đã được sử dụng hoặc tồn tại trong một thời gian dài

examples: The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
The new loan takes the total debt to $100 000.
The new president takes office in January.
Fans have given the band's new song their seal of approval.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
words.defineEn: recently built, invented, made, etc.
words.defineVi: được xây dựng, phát minh, chế tạo gần đây, v.v.

examples: The purple flowers in the vase were beautiful.
My mom planted beautiful flowers in the front yard.
It's beautiful!
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
The vibrant purple color of whinberries adds a beautiful touch to desserts like cheesecakes and tarts.
words.defineEn: extremely pleasing to the mind or senses
words.defineVi: cực kỳ dễ chịu cho tâm trí hoặc các giác quan

examples: The game turned ugly in the final minutes, when two players were ejected for fighting.
She received an ugly haircut that she immediately regretted.
I can't believe tax day is already rearing its ugly head again.
He drew an ugly picture that didn't resemble anything recognizable.
The old, torn sweater she wore was ugly and outdated.
words.defineEn: not pleasant to the mind or senses
words.defineVi: không dễ chịu cho tâm trí hoặc các giác quan

examples: The mother gently cleaned her baby's ears with a cotton swab.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
Sarah cleans the kitchen counters with a sponge.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
She cleans the dining room after each meal.
words.defineEn: not having any stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, dấu vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
He wore dirty shoes that left muddy footprints on the floor.
The dirty dishes in the restaurant's kitchen needed to be washed.
He had a dirty face after playing in the mud.
words.defineEn: having stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: có vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
Using the camera was as easy as pie.
It's an easy exam.
words.defineEn: needing little skill or effort to do or understand
words.defineVi: cần ít kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm hoặc hiểu

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: having a high speed when moving or doing something
words.defineVi: có tốc độ cao khi di chuyển hoặc làm gì đó

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
The slow elevator took a long time to reach the desired floor.
Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
She had a slow learning pace but never gave up.
words.defineEn: moving, happening, or being done at a speed that is low
words.defineVi: di chuyển, xảy ra hoặc được thực hiện ở tốc độ thấp

examples: Everyone has different interests.
The figures tell a different story.
Actually, I wear several different hats.
He had a different perspective on the movie.
She studied different subjects in school, from math to history.
words.defineEn: not like another thing or person in form, quality, nature, etc.
words.defineVi: không giống sự vật, con người khác về hình thức, phẩm chất, bản chất, v.v.

examples: The two friends had similar tastes in music, enjoying the same bands and artists.
She and her sister look very similar, but they have very different personalities.
He found two similar shirts in different colors, deciding to buy both.
He inherited his father's love of music and talent for playing the guitar - like father, like son, they share similar interests and skills.
Her success in the industry had opened doors for other women to pursue similar careers.
words.defineEn: (of two or more things) having qualities in common that are not exactly the same
words.defineVi: (của hai hoặc nhiều thứ) có những phẩm chất chung không hoàn toàn giống nhau

examples: Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
That extension is busy right now.
I want a dish of creamy mushroom bucatini with Parmesan right now.
Right by holding the candle to the devil.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
words.defineEn: based on facts or the truth
words.defineVi: dựa trên sự thật hoặc sự thật

examples: In his mother’s eyes, the boy can do no wrong.
The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.
I accidentally hit the wrong key.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
She pressed the wrong button and accidentally deleted the file.
words.defineEn: not based on facts or the truth
words.defineVi: không dựa trên sự thật hay sự thật

examples: The driver of the car opened the car door for the passengers.
The waiter opened the bottle of wine for the guests.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
right on cue the door opened
The store stays open late on Thursdays.
words.defineEn: letting people or things pass through
words.defineVi: để người hoặc vật đi qua

examples: "The discussion is closed."
The closed window blocked out the noise from the street.
The closed lid of the jar preserved the freshness of the food inside.
The meeting was held behind closed doors.
She received a closed envelope containing a surprise gift.
words.defineEn: not letting things, people, etc. go in or out
words.defineVi: không cho đồ vật, người, v.v. ra vào

examples: May your wildest dreams come true!
A true leader walks the talk.
The true story inspired many people around the world.
Calamity is man's true touchstone.
Her true feelings were finally out in the open.
words.defineEn: according to reality or facts
words.defineVi: theo thực tế hoặc sự kiện

examples: A reporter obtained documents from the company under false pretenses.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
He shared false information without verifying its accuracy.
She received false advice that led to negative consequences.
She received a false promise that was never fulfilled.
words.defineEn: not according to reality or facts
words.defineVi: không theo thực tế hoặc sự kiện

examples: The rich family owned a private jet.
The rich man bought a big house and a fancy car.
The rich businessman owned multiple luxurious cars.
Asparagus beanare rich in iron and vitamin K.
Asian cultures have a rich heritage of art, music, and dance.
words.defineEn: owning a great amount of money or many things that cost a lot
words.defineVi: sở hữu một số tiền lớn hoặc nhiều thứ có giá rất cao

examples: His family is as poor as a Job's turkey.
The poor girl was almost beside herself.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
That poor kid is shaking in his shoes up there on stage.
And now the poor thing is crying his heart out.
words.defineEn: owning a very small amount of money or a very small number of things
words.defineVi: sở hữu một số tiền rất nhỏ hoặc một số lượng rất nhỏ của những thứ

examples: Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.
That player sure got the bird after he dropped the ball.
The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
He felt sure about his answer during the exam.
You can be sure of that.
words.defineEn: feeling confident about something being correct or true
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tự tin về một cái gì đó là đúng hoặc đúng

examples: The teacher corrected my mistake and explained the correct solution.
She gave a correct response to the teacher's question.
His correct pronunciation impressed everyone in the language class.
The teacher highlighted the correct steps to solve the math problem.
After numerous inspections, the correct answer to this dilemma still remains at sea.
words.defineEn: based on the truth and without mistakes
words.defineVi: dựa trên sự thật và không có sai lầm

examples: His incorrect translation of the phrase caused a misunderstanding between the two parties.
She realized that the information in the textbook was incorrect.
She received a warning for using incorrect grammar in her writing assignment.
In recent years, comedians have found themselves in hot water for making politically incorrect topics about everything from race to gender.
The map he was using had incorrect directions.
words.defineEn: having mistakes; not correct or true
words.defineVi: có lỗi lầm; không đúng hoặc đúng
